name: Cleanup.pictures
description: Cleanup.pictures is an AI-powered online tool for removing unwanted objects, people, text, or defects from photos in seconds.
longDescription: Cleanup.pictures is a web-based platform that leverages advanced AI inpainting technology to simplify photo editing for users of all skill levels. Its mission is to provide an intuitive, accessible tool for creating clean, professional-quality images without requiring complex software like Adobe Photoshop. The platform allows users to upload images, select unwanted elements with a brush tool, and let AI seamlessly reconstruct the background, making it ideal for enhancing product photos, travel images, or personal portraits. It serves photographers, e-commerce sellers, social media influencers, and casual users by offering a fast, user-friendly solution to remove distractions and improve visual aesthetics. The free version supports basic editing with a resolution limit, while the Pro version unlocks high-resolution exports and advanced features. The tool is also integrated into the ClipDrop app, extending its functionality to mobile users.
features: AI-powered inpainting removes unwanted objects, people, or text from photos with a single brush stroke, delivering seamless results.
The magic brush tool allows users to highlight areas for removal, simplifying the editing process for beginners and professionals alike.
Supports image uploads of any size, with free version exports limited to 720px and no limits for Pro users.
The platform offers a user-friendly interface with zoom and brush size adjustments for precise editing.
Integrated with the ClipDrop app, enabling photo cleanup on both mobile and desktop devices.
API access allows developers to integrate Cleanup.picturesâ€™ inpainting technology into their own applications.
The before-and-after tool lets users compare edited images to ensure desired results.
High-resolution image processing is available with a Pro subscription, ideal for professional-grade outputs.
The AI reconstructs backgrounds naturally, eliminating smears or distortions common in traditional clone stamp tools.

faqs.question: What is Cleanup.pictures used for?
faqs.answer: Cleanup.pictures is used to remove unwanted objects, people, text, or defects from photos using AI-powered inpainting technology.

faqs.question: Is Cleanup.pictures free to use?
faqs.answer: Yes, the platform offers a free version with core features, but exports are limited to 720px resolution; a Pro subscription unlocks high-resolution exports.

faqs.question: Do I need photo editing skills to use Cleanup.pictures?
faqs.answer: No, the tool is designed for all users, with a simple brush-based interface that requires no professional editing skills.

faqs.question: Can I use Cleanup.pictures on my phone?
faqs.answer: Yes, Cleanup.pictures is integrated into the ClipDrop app, available for iOS and Android, allowing mobile photo editing.

faqs.question: What types of images can I edit with Cleanup.pictures?
faqs.answer: You can edit photos, graphics, and artwork, including portraits, landscapes, product images, and more, in PNG or JPG formats.

faqs.question: How does the AI inpainting technology work?
faqs.answer: The AI analyzes the selected area and reconstructs the background by predicting what should be there, delivering natural-looking results.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the image size I can upload?
faqs.answer: You can upload images of any size, but the free version limits exports to 720px, while the Pro version has no resolution limits.

faqs.question: Can I integrate Cleanup.pictures into my own application?
faqs.answer: Yes, Cleanup.pictures offers an API for developers to incorporate its AI inpainting technology into their projects.

faqs.question: What is the cost of the Pro version?
faqs.answer: The Pro version costs $5 per month or $36 per year ($3 per month), but visit https://x.ai/grok for current pricing details.

faqs.question: Does Cleanup.pictures support bulk image processing?
faqs.answer: Bulk processing is not directly supported in the web interface, but the API allows developers to automate batch edits.
